result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucy Ann McCoy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE TO THE CLERK OF COURT. If not timely paid in full, defendant may be ordered to spend one day in the county jail for each $50.00 amount owed, with huber privileges, and the remaining unpaid obligation will be docketed & enforced as a civil judgment against the defendant. The defendant shall keep the Clerk of Court's office advised of any change of address until the obligation is paid in full.

Defendant shall submit to and comply with any evaluation, assessment, counselling and/or treatment, as deemed appropriate by Probation Agent and shall pay all applicable costs of same. Shall include AODA counselling and/or treatment.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any intoxicants or, unless modified by Probation Agent, shall not enter upon the premises of any business serving intoxicating beverages except as necessary for employment purposes.
Defendant shall have no contact with Guy Wade.

Defendant shall cooperate and comply with any Health and Human Services order.  If defendant has not already done so, he/she shall provide a biological specimen to the State Crime Laboratory for deoxyribonucleic acid analysis (DNA testing) pursuant to Section 973.047(1f) Wis. Stats.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
